comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Terrific photo. There are heaps of versions of this image, but this is by far the clearest. I am wondering what the provenance is? Contemporary description of the 'Great Victoria' - SMH 5/12/1863 p.6 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13088322

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The 'Great Victoria' in full sail - 'Illustrated London News' October 1863, NLA

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Hi Beachcomber, the image came in with the Hood Studio Collection, however it is too early to have been taken by Hood himself. I believe that the date for the image came from Graeme Andrews who used the same image in his book 'A Pictorial History of Ferries', (1982).
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Ps thanks for the info about Lang - formidable!
